title: Constitution Act, 1982
summary: The Constitution Act, 1982 (French: Loi constitutionnelle de 1982) is a part of the Constitution of Canada.[lower-alpha 1] The Act was introduced as part of Canada's process of patriating the constitution, introducing several amendments to the British North America Act, 1867, including re-naming it the Constitution Act, 1867.[lower-alpha 2] In addition to patriating the Constitution, the Constitution Act, 1982 enacted the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms; guaranteed rights of the Aboriginal peoples of Canada; provided for future constitutional conferences; and set out the procedures for amending the Constitution in the future.
